function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Variations/heterogeneity in the relationships between built and natural environment, chronic disease, and COVID-19 mortality","Impact":"Inaccurate models and predictions, leading to ineffective public health interventions","Mitigation":"Gather more comprehensive data on built and natural environment factors and their impact on disease spread","Technologies":"Data collection and analysis tools, simulation-assisted random parameter models","People":"Public health researchers, policymakers, urban planners","Owner":"Public health departments, research institutions"},{"Description":"Fluid nature of COVID-19 data, especially the resurgence of the virus in the United States during winters","Impact":"Misleading or outdated data leading to ineffective responses to the pandemic","Mitigation":"Regularly update and validate COVID-19 data, consider seasonal variations and regional differences","Technologies":"Real-time data tracking and analysis tools, predictive modeling for seasonal trends","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, data analysts","Owner":"Health departments, data analysis teams"},{"Description":"Associations of density and socio-demographic factors with COVID-19 mortality","Impact":"Limited understanding of the impact of density and socio-demographic factors on COVID-19 mortality","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive studies considering various socio-demographic and environmental factors, account for confounding variables","Technologies":"Data analytics, simulation-assisted modeling, spatial analysis tools","People":"Epidemiologists, demographers, public health researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health departments"}]}
